Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and service”
Reviews.Author: Lyndah38
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in January to celebrate my niece's birthday. The staff found out that it was her 13th birthday and while we were out shopping, they went to a local bakery and bought her a cake! So unexpected and nice! The hotel was clean, the service was amazing, and the location was perfect. We spent a lot of time at the American Girl store and it was right around the corner, not to mention, there is a Garrett's Popcorn across the street so you can stalk it for when the lines are low. The breakfast is also a nice savings. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Chiili
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel a few years ago and thought it was the best deal in town. However, this stay was not what I expected. We rented 7 rooms and everyone in our party complained how dirty the rooms were. This hotel needs a face lift! Free breakfast- forget it! Just awful. When I got back also found they charge all rooms for the car when we only had one and charge us for rooms we never had. Now have to call hotel to get it taken care of. Not a happy camper

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.. great price”
Reviews.Author: irishgal09
Reviews.Content: A terrific place to stay in Chicago. Just steps away from Michigan Ave shopping and lots of great restaurants. Our suite was very large and perfectly clean. The staff was nice. Breakfast was okay.. nothing special, but it was free, so we didn't expect much. We'll stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfort and staff!”
Reviews.Author: ChristiB50
Reviews.Content: My daughter is moving to Chicago, so we made a quick trip to apartment hunt. The staff of the hotel were very helpful in that detail as well - offering information about neighborhoods and commutes, as well as providing maps. The hotel itself is comfortable, not fancy. We had a quiet room on the 11th floor. Breakfast was well-stocked and provided more than enough for us. The hotel's value is high, given that it was one of the least expensive options in the area. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant services and location”
Reviews.Author: Terry L
Reviews.Content: A recent stay at this hotel connected with a Northwestern Memorial hospital stay resulted in exception service and hospitality. The front desk and room services staff were remarkably friendly and most helpful with all our questions and requests. I would highly recommend this facility especially if you are in need of a place to stay in connection with a procedure to be done at Northwestern Memorial Hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: beachlover101101
Reviews.Content: This was in a great location. The lobby was very hip looking. The outside doors are locked at night which made me feel safe. The room I stayed in was small/queen bed. The streets were loud at night and the tub was not clean (hair in it). However, it was fine for a one night stay. I missed the super comfy beds the Marriot brands usually have, but like I said - fine for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location & great stay”
Reviews.Author: bri1759
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Family friendly ( waffles) and near it all! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price!”
Reviews.Author: richdeblove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Christmas Holidays for 1 night. The location was great. Within walking distance to many restaurants & shopping What a great value for the downtown area. The room was a little small, but we weren't in it that long anyways. It was just the 2 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away In The Windy City”
Reviews.Author: BTCompKSU
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find a hotel room in the city of Chicago for less than $100, let alone a GOOD hotel room. This hotel was very modern, with a super friendly staff that was very accommodating. We actually screwed up our reservation, thinking that we had reserved a suite when we hadn't. The hotel was able to offer us a second room at the original rate, even though the current rates were much higher. They also provided us a much needed roll away at no additional charge. Everyone got free complimentary breakfast (included with stay). This was strictly continental plus a waffle maker... very crowded but there was ample space we were able to grab a table. The parking fees are high, but we didn't have a car so that didn't matter. The fitness room also contained some treadmills with tvs and an elliptical. The hotel also offered free wifi. The next time we stay in Chicago, we will definitely look to this hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Fun”
Reviews.Author: Mindy0210
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011. The positives about this hotel is that it is within walking distance 2-4 blocks to some really great restaurants and a cab ride to Navy Pier. The room was very nice with internet service, extra towels and fluffy pillows. The negatives about this hotel is the first room they gave us only had one queen bed, well this didn't work since we are a family of four, so we had to call the fron desk and arrange for another room , they appologized and sent us to a double queen, which had the view of a roof top and air conditioning eqipment. What we did not like was the price that had been quoted us changed when we checked out, we stayed three nights with the first night at the quoted price around $200 and the other 2 nights at a $150 increase in price per night, we flipped out!!! I asked why the increase since this was during the middle of the week Tuesday-Thursday and they said anytime a big concert series comes through rates increased to weekend prices. They did not change the rate to what we were originally given. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: uscballer9
Reviews.Content: This place delivers on many aspects but of course that depends on your expectations. If you're looking for affordability, comfort and location, this place scores on all three. This was a quick business trip and I needed a place that's affordable and comfortable and this place served that purpose! Monica at front desk was professional and helpful. She called my room 15 mins after I checked in just to see if I was satisfied with the room. And I should mention I never experienced this with 4-5 stars hotels that I have stayed in. The property itself is clean and modern. The lobby is nice and spacious with big screen tv. Elevators are always available. Hallways are well lit. The room might be on a small side to some but I found it to my liking, which is cozy. The bed, mattress and pillows were all in good shape and comfortable, no noise from neighbors next door or cars or constructions outside. I slept through the whole night, but heater can be a bit noisy for light sleepers. Bathroom is quite small but served its purpose with no problem. Hot water available for the duration of my shower with good water pressure. The location really cant be beat only steps away to Magnificent Mile and most attractions are within walking distance. You can walk from Oak St. Beach all the way down to Buckingham Fountain or hotel to Navy Pier (some might find this task daunting). Banks and convenient stores are nearby not to mention the restaurants for every tastes. Did not get a chance to take advantage of free continental breakfast, free internet with good speed was included in the room rate which was $69 a night. If you get hungry in the middle of the night, you can call front desk for menus of restaurants that are open late and delivers. All expectations were met and then some, I'd definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and help from Jennifer and Carlos”
Reviews.Author: 1Jbaker
Reviews.Content: They advsed us on restaurants, sightseeing, always good, and offered their assistance in any way wewanted. Would defintely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Fairfield”
Reviews.Author: momundo
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal including valet parking and breakfast for 4. Was expecting coffee and donuts, but the selection was amazing (fruit, cereal, oatmeal, waffles, sweetrolls, bagels, eggs) Staff was very friendly and let us keep our bags there for the day so we could explore Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “nice weekend”
Reviews.Author: nguyens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend it was so nice. I cannot believe for $89 a night how clean and nice the room was. This place was quiet and the location cannot be beat. We did a AAA rate on the king suite. The only con I have is I wish it had a door between the living area and the bedroom. I was impressed from check in to check out. The staff we encountered were friendly the breakfast was ok ( for a free breakfast very impressive) the location is everything you are close to Michigan Avenue, Navy Pier, Northwestern Hospital and any cuisine you can imagine has just a 10 minute walk. The only reason it did not get excellent is the towel quality is what you would expect in this price range and the bed was ok but I am spoiled and everytime someone moved I felt it. It was not the Trump but it was also $300 less per night. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: wdbtchrsmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights so I could be close to the hospital and was very pleased. It was convenient, comfortable, and fairly priced. My room was modern and extremely clean. I would definitely recommend it for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome! The location was very convenient for me, as I was there for an interview at Northwestern. It's like a 1 min walk to the hospital. Also a very convenient 5 min walk to the Grand Red station, which is like 1 stop away from Jackson for transferring to/from the Blue Line. Staff was very helpful; they helped me find a replacement for my forgotten laptop charger and provided me a list of all the restaurants nearby. Complimentary breakfast was great quality with tons of options, including fresh fruit. The rooms and the hotel are in very clean, well-kept, and modern condition. I had a queen room. It may be a little small for some people, but I didn't mind it. You would be very pleased if you stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Almost everything about this place was great”
Reviews.Author: Joseph T
Reviews.Content: Superb location, nice decor/lobby/front desk staff, $89 a night room. What's not to like? My only complaint was that the internet in my room was very, very slow, which made work difficult. I did not try the free breakfast, unfortunately, so I can't comment there.

Reviews.Title: “Every stay has been superb!”
Reviews.Author: Ntransit
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least three or four times now, and I have never been disappointed. The hotel is modern, well maintained, and reasonably priced. The guest rooms are extremely clean with updated decor. I have been extremely impressed with the professional and friendly nature of the staff, and I have felt very welcome during each stay. Lastly, the hotel's location is excellent--just 1.5 blocks east of Michigan Avenue. I definitely look forward to staying at the Fairfield Inn & Suites on a future visit to downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “You are crazy to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Pamela T
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the country. Out of all of the hotels to stay in chicago, i choose the fairfield inn downtown. Why would you want to stay anywhere else? The location alone is amazing. The price is reasonable. Forget all of that,...you have clean retro style rooms with LG big tv's! Staff is over the top with their welcome smile and assistance. The breakfast is always on time and hot. I have nothing to say negative about this wonderful home away from home. I have informed many local residents that the fairfield inn is a great place to stay when you are out for a weekend in the city too! You are right in the middle of the miracle mile and lake michigan. A few of the top floors have a great view of the lake. Janet and her crew are the best! Try it you will like it!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: FatherDaughterTravel
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel (in my opinion). Janet (the woman at the front desk), was really nice and helpful when it came to restaurants and directions. The rooms were awesome. They have TWO TV's in the King Suite. TWO!:) It was in a great spot right next to The Magnificent Mile. -Daughter

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: Great location just 2 blocks east of Michigan Avenue. Good value with breakfast included. A short walk to bus stops and the L is only a few blocks to the west (State Street). The 151 bus runs from Union Station and the Loop to a bus stop a few blocks west of the hotel. The 151 runs north to Lincoln Park too. It's easy walking distance from the hotel to the river to the south and John Hancock Tower to the north, so it's a short walk to all the stores in between. Hotel has double beds, not queen. Some construction noise from a building getting torn down nearby. The heating and a/c unit has the option to continuously run the fan, which helps mask noise. Safe neighborhood with lots of pedestrian traffic. Bottom line: would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Over and above”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Huge thanks to Monica and Kenny; went out of their way to accomodate our shifting situation and and making it work for us!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: chriscpd98
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Decent neighborhood. View not very scenic from 10th flr room. No pool. No parking. Small bathroom. Clean. Very pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Sheraton or Inn of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyFamilyman
Reviews.Content: Over the past 3 years, I stayed in Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers (301 east n. Water St.), Fairfield Inn (Ontario St) and the Inn of Chicago (Ohio St). For tourists, the Sheraton's location is inconvenient. Inn of Chicago's location is convenient just like the Fairfield Inn, both are very close to the Magnificient mile. I would definitely stay again at Fairfield Inn. Not only is this a much newer building than the Inn of Chicago but also serves free breakfast. The breakfast includes make-your-own waffle, Jimmy Dean biscuit with bacon and cheese, oatmeal (not the instant kind), hard-boiled eggs, cereal, bagels, pastries and fresh fruits. The room rate at this hotel is very reasonable. Would definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Bias and Unfair”
Reviews.Author: BJS50
Reviews.Content: This is a nonsmoking hotel and I followed these rules during my whole stay but, I got charged $250 because they found an empty pack of cigarettes in the trash along with a few cigarette butts. The butts were from me shaking my finished cigarettes out while walking downtown (because I don't litter) and putting them in my back pocket. I followed up on the matter and was told the charge is nonrefundable! The valet staff, front desk, and security cameras are all witnesses that I went outside all weekend to smoke. I followed the hotel smoking policy, don't litter, and I'm a respectful smoker and get charged $250. I should of just smoke in the room all weekend!! Never going back here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Best Kept Secret"”
Reviews.Author: Mary W
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers it all!!! Friendly helpful staff, wonderful assistant manager, clean and quiet rooms, 500 feet from Michigan Avenue, 300 feet from Garrett's Popcorn! I don't know why anyone would want to stay anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: kobuse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four days while attending a conference in Chicago. It was a very pleasant experience. Rooms are quite spacious, clean and airy. The beds were comfortable and the staff were really very friendly. The top feature of this hotel must be the excellent location on the Magnificient Mile and really close to both the tourist-trappy Navy Pier and several CTA 'L' stops. The area also has several restaurants and easy access to all the major attractions. A continental breakfast is included and the hotel also has fitness and business centres. Compared to several more expensive options, this hotel was a great deal and exactly what you need for value-for-money accommodation in downtown Chicago. It comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wygfo5
Reviews.Content: From the valet parking through to the maids, the staff at this facility were very helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel is very good, and if you're looking for a quiet little hideaway while you shop, this is a great place to stay, offering good value. You truly are within walking distance from most attractions, with a wealth of taxi's driving by the front door to take you to those that aren't nearby. We found the breakfast room over-crowded on one morning, and we had to split our group (of four) up, but I noticed that there were several smaller families that did not get a place to sit, so timing is crucial! However the food was replenished often - even when it was getting close to the breakfast closing time - so you could always come down and take your breakfast back to your room. It's not a luxury hotel by any stretch of the imagination, but it does what it says on the front of the box, and it's good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A great time.”
Reviews.Author: Anon-I-Muss
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, small, in a great location. Only a couple of blocks off N. Michigan Ave. Walking distance to the Navy Pier (about 15 minutes). Walking distance to a movie complex (10 minutes). One block to the place to buy Chicago mix--popcorn combination of caramel and cheddar cheese. Great service by Charles. Excellent service by Monica. Front desk was helpful and courteous. Room was comfortable. The front desk upgraded us to a suite at their initiative. We were there on points. The breakfasts were convenient and tasty. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value and Fine Location”
Reviews.Author: chrisfromrochester
Reviews.Content: From the warm welcome at the front desk to my pleasant and spacious suite, the Fairfield Inn impressed me. Cleanliness, comfort, and convenience were all top notch. The extended hours for breakfast and the sizeable breakfast room were nice surprises and the food was good too--even the coffee, often a problem at budget hotels. I've stayed around the corner at the Doubletree on other trips to Chicago, but the Fairfield Inn seems as nice and at a much better price.

Reviews.Title: “Guest Services”
Reviews.Author: joan1440
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff, specifically Carlos, was awesome. He is all about customer service-something not seen often, these days. Hotel was clean and location was good. Only complaint-the bathroom sink-not enough space on which to place make-up, etc. Great job, Carlos!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: LITraveler811
Reviews.Content: When our original choice of hotel was booked, we looked for another choice for a group of 10 for our Chicago get-together. Our top criteria were location, price and 2 beds in a room. When I found the Fairfield Inn & Suites, I then consulted Tripadvisor. The reviews were all positive, talking about a clean hotel, good location, and great breakfast. It was exactly as promised. The hotel is 1 1/2 blocks from Michigan Avenue, close to many department and specialty stores. It is less than a mile walk from Navy pier. The hotel was clean, staff was very helpful and friendly, and the breakfast offering were perfect for our group, and varied enough. Although the breakfast room was sometimes crowded, we ended up being able to find something open quickly. One great find to suggest at Navy Pier is the stained glass museum. It is located in a corridor towards the back, and is free, but was a real unexpected treat. Another thing we enjoyed while there was a performance at Second City, which is located in a more hopping part of town as far as night-life goes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: 1montereyman
Reviews.Content: Downtown big city hotels can be very expensive, so I was pleased to find this one with a good rate in comparison. And it's hard to beat the location - one block off North Michigan. My adult son and I stayed at the Fairfield while in Chicago for a family event. We found the room clean and pleasant. The breakfast room was large with a decent "continental" selection. Will certainly stay again for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the $$”
Reviews.Author: turco_fan
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, no-frills place to stay in downtown Chicago, this is it. Great location off the Magnificent Mile and an easy walk from the Navy Pier. (A manageable walk from the museum campus as well if you are feeling adventurous.) Staff was very friendly and welcoming. Rooms are a bit on the small side, but who wants to hang out in a hotel room when you are in Chicago?! Would definitely stay here again. Also appreciated the free continental breakfast each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Like Family!”
Reviews.Author: Carla r
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 11 days while our mother was at Northwestern for heart surgery. We cannot say enough good about the staff. They were all so kind and helpful and went above and beyond to help us. They helped us when we needed to extend our stay, provided extra everything, helped us make reservations for Amtrak and showed concern and compassion for our mother. This is a very clean, comfortable hotel...good coffee, good breakfast...treated us like family!!!Thank-you Kenneth, Cruz, Jennifer, the tall doorman, all the desk employees, the gals in the breakfast area and the housekeeping staff!!!! Not one rude or unkind staff person. This is so close and convenient to Northwestern. It is only about a half a block away, mostly covered overtop. We will be back. Highly recommend. From 4 Sisters rm 208

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cdgrif
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at the cleaniness of the hotel and the professionalism of the staff. The rooms were small but they were extremely clean and comfortable. The front desk staff were very helpful with dinner recommendations and with holding our luggage while we were at a conference. The have valet parking and for the same cost we were able to leave our vehicle there for more than 24 hours. I highly recommend the Fairfield Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Vince E
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend in chicago and great place to stay...staff is friendly and accommodating, room was cozy and quiet, and this place is close to a lot of landmarks and nightlife...did I mention the food? Thanks to the manager (Jennifer I think?) for the great coupons! I recommend this hotel and will stay there again:-)

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: fam5-traveler
Reviews.Content: We took a quick 2 day family vacation in downtown Chicago to do visit the museum of Science & Industry and do some shopping along the "Mag-Mile". The desk staff helped us greatly by getting us a "priority pass" to Gino's which allowed us to be seated in 10 minutes while there was a Friday evening line at least 100' long outside the door (little kids and Grandma's don't do well standing in long lines). The next night we got a Kid's eat free at Weber's which was also a big money saver. The valets were also very helpful & careful as they parked our F150 super crew truck without a scratch. All the staff we interacted with went out of their way to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, stay, and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: juanowens
Reviews.Content: Great hotel the service is exceptional Jennifer & Kenny are amazing.... Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: Art Murnan M
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a weekend @ the Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown. It was a wonderful experience! Being greeted by Jennifer, the hotel manager upon check in was a very nice start and her staff just kept the service going! The rooms are a little small, but for a few days it is definately the place to stay. Located in the area of all the fun attractions there is never a lack of things to do. Charles and Cruz were both helpful, and Cruz gave me a pass to a local pizza place and we got right in. AMAZING Customer Service! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: vacationtimeTexas
Reviews.Content: The location and service at this hotel is great! Carlos at the front desk was a great help along with everyone else. Everytime we needed directions or recommendations they were so nice and willing. They offer breakfast every morning which was nice. It is served till 10am which was great ,even at 9:30 they were still bringing food out. The rooms are nice and large. We were across from the elevators which was not a problem at all. Overall this hotel is great for the price and location we would diffidently stay they again !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an even better location”
Reviews.Author: paavoman
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to Chicago for a long weekend which also included a Cubs game. This hotel was perfect. The location was near everything we wanted. We were within walking distance of all the sites and the train to Wrigley field.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience all around!”
Reviews.Author: MLouNolan
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect for us. Kenneth helped us at the front desk and his friendly and welcoming attitude started it off right. He upgraded us to a king sized bed without even asking for it. The room was very attractive, extremely clean and quite roomy with a nice bathroom and great shower. The bed was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast room was pleasant and we didn't find it to be overly crowded as someone mentioned. The selection was very good and fresh and bountiful. The coffee was available all day. We don't travel with a laptop so we didn't use the wifi but they had three working computers available with printers. The location was very good...about six blocks from the subway and only two from a major bus stop. We bougtht the week CTA card and were really able to get around the city well from there. There is a Garrett's popcorn place across the street that will draw you in with the smell...and it was well worth it. We got the Chicago Mix and enjoyed every bite! We had a great time in Chicago and loved the Fairfield Inn there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jreitzel
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and the hotel was super clean! The location was great with lots of restaurants and shopping nearby, we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst rooms I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: BookbuyerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of the generally positive reviews other guests have had. I had a suite booked with a so called separate room as I was traveling with my business partner. We were given room 310 which was a pokey room that really could not be called a suite. What was worse was the location which was about three meters from the main building air conditioning units which would roar to life on and off all night long. The sofa bed was also of a quality that was reminiscent of my grandmothers threadbare wonder bed leaving little to the imagination on how the springs worked. The staff were pleasant but this was a criminally over priced hotel for the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with a very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Frank11177
Reviews.Content: A very clean room with a staff that will work hard to meet every need you might have. I requested a fridge and it was delivered to the room within minutes. I doubt you will find a better hotel for the price this close to downtown if you are looking for a peaceful nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reactor1966
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several days for business. Very clean, very quiet in the rooms. Free breakfast was ok, about what I would expect. Location is very convenient - restaurants and stores all within walking distance. Cabs can be hard to get here though - best to have the front desk call in advance. Also, the position of my room was on an inside corner, so if you went up to the window you could look right into your neighbors room, which was a little strange. Overall though, I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel meets expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: The location is great-wonderful restaurants, the lakefront, and shopping nearby. The hotel is small, with small rooms. The rooms are all modern and nice, beds are comfortable. There is not much of a view, as this hotel is much smaller than the surrounding buildings. I prefer the residence inn River North over this property, but when it is not available this property is fine, if you don't plan on spending too much time in the small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Cindy P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel in September for 6 nights. It was our first visit to Chicago and we could not have chosen a better hotel. The location was great just a block or so from Michigan Ave. and The Magnificient Mile. In the other direction we could walk down to the lake front and enjoy Lakeshore Drive. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable and clean. The complimentary continental breakfast was good and saved us time in the morning and money. I would recommend this hotel to others and we would definitely stay there agan if we returned to Chicago for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: GreenBay1967
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the weekend stay here. The entire staff was attentive and handled all our requests with ease. Clean rooms, and the night staff were kind and would help w/directions and safety when we sat outside to people watch, I would have no problem telling anyone wanting to stay in the city to stay there. Craig Taucher Creative Design Installations, Inc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: stefmo
Reviews.Content: Just a block-or-so off Michigan Avenue, this hotel is in a great location with many outstanding restaurants nearby. The front desk staff, the concierge, and the bellhops were all so friendly and helpful. After check out, I had to store our luggage until my husband was finished with the business portion of our trip, and the staff was exceedingly accommodating. I hung out in the lobby for about an hour after I'd exhausted my shopping gene, and was offered ice water or a snack - even though we were no longer officially "guests" of the hotel. One of the guys flagged a taxi for us, even helping load our luggage. If you check a Google-earth view, you'll see that this property is shaped like the letter C. The long (west) side of the building is the elevator and stair tower, leaving the inner part of the long side for four rooms, with an additional five rooms at the "top and bottom" of the C (on a typical floor). If you're unlucky enough to get one of the four rooms across from the elevators (as we were), you will have zero view unless you crane your neck. Even on the 12th floor, we could only see the blank wall of the high-rise next door. In a city of tall buildings, though, this is pretty typical. Not sure any of the other rooms had better views, either, but judging by window placement, I'd assume and hope they do! The other issue with being across from the elevators is the associated noise. I realize that can't be helped, and the hotel isn't responsible for inconsiderate guests! So - if you go, and your room number ends in 06, 07, 08, or 09 - ask for a different room, unless you don't mind being directly across from the elevators. The elevators open into the hallway - there's no elevator lobby - so it's quite a cramped area. The main floor lobby is decorated in a very modernist style, with funky furniture and lighting. It's looking a bit worn, but it is extremely clean. The second floor has two guest rooms, a fitness center, and the breakfast room. The breakfast area, which is located at the bottom of the "C," is large by typical "free breakfast area" standards, and a great selection of food is provided: fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, waffle irons, breakfast sandwiches, boiled eggs, several types of bread, coffee, juice... Long windows overlook Ontario Avenue. Our room, which was typically sized, had two double beds, a side chair, desk with task chair, and a dresser/tv stand combo. The "closet" was really only a shallow niche in the wall next to the bathroom. The bed was OK - had up-rated linens and lots of pillows, but it seemed uncomfortable to us. The orange (just letting you know it's BRIGHT) carpet was extremely worn, but seemed clean enough - even though an orange TicTac was on the floor under the window both nights of our stay. I can easily see how that would be missed by a cleaning crew - same color as the carpet, but does this mean they don't vacuum thoroughly? As I was packing to check out, my foot "bumped" something under one of the beds... A half-full liter-sized bottle of Coca Cola. Really? How long had that been there? We don't drink Coke, so it definitely wasn't ours... And the beds are on platforms, so there's only about 6" of space under the dust ruffle of the beds. Again - vacuuming??? A vacuum would have surely dislodged the bottle, as my foot did... I'd consider staying here again, but I'd check the room thoroughly before unpacking! The first night of our stay, I used Marriott points and the second night my husband's company picked up the tab, so I guess "free" is a good value for this hotel! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: ZEBRAQUEEN
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed their in August, just 1 night, had a suite, fyi, all suites face inward...meaning you will not have a view...it served its purpose, was clean & enough room..2 tv's etc...I am a Marriott rewards member and they must consider improving the quality of the towels...they are motel 6, 1960..I found it that way at a Courtyard and a Renassiance. Anyway, location is great, cannot go wrong staying here.....did not do the breakfast...everyone was nice.....close to all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, very clean, everyone was very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: MountainLvr48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites over Labor Day weekend. It was very reasonably priced compared to other hotels in the area. So much so that we were a bit concerned about quality. We had nothing to worry about. Our room was clean, had toiletries, coffee, iron and ironing board and a nice large t.v.. We checked on breakfast but thought we'd end up going to a restaurant. We didn't. The breakfast had a great selection, not your typical doughnuts and coffee continental breakfast. The location was perfect, we walked to Navy Pier, Water Tower Place, and there were lots of restaurants nearby for dinner. The best asset this hotel had was its staff. I didn't meet many friendly people in Chicago, but the ones i did were all working here. Everyone was great! Glad I followed TripAdvisor members' suggestions and stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: Galadina
Reviews.Content: Just two blocks from Michigan Avenue. Great location if you're shopping the Magnificent Mile! The room was really tiny, but it was only two of us, so it worked.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: cham62
Reviews.Content: My sister and I visited Chicago to celebrate her 50th birthday this past weekend (August 26-29). We had plans to visit NYC, but Hurricane Irene caused us to change our plans and book a last-minute trip to Chicago and to reschedule the NYC trip. We were really disappointed about the NYC trip interruption, as my sister has never been to NYC, and we had so many plans, but we love Chicago, so we decided to vist an old favorite for the weekend to make up for the disappointment. Did we ever make the right decision! We visit Chicago on a regular basis - usually once at Christmas time and once in the summer -- as a halfway meeting point, as my sister lives on the west side of Illinois, and I live in mid-Michigan. We usually stay in The Loop area at the Palmer House Hilton, but we decided to try something new for this last minute trip. We booked the Fairfield Inn on Ontario Street because its rates were very reasonable, and it is a really nice location for those who want to hang out on the Magnificient Mile and at Navy Pier and the Ohio Street and Oak Street Beaches and the Lakeshore Trail. The rooms were smallish, but very nice, bright, clean, quiet (even though our room was across from the elevator), the flat-screen TV was huge and had great resolution (although we spent almost no time in the room except to sleep, we did check up on Hurricane Irene every now and then). We were very pleased with the accommodations. And the accommodations were nothing compared to the staff -- the staff was really, really wonderful!! We want to thank Monica, Janet, and Charles, who could not have been more friendly or helpful, and, in particular, we want to say thank you to Kenneth, the "handsome guy behind the desk," who, when he learned that it was my sister's 50th birthday celebration (she doesn't look age 50 at all), demanded to see her drivers' license as proof, which tinkled my sister PINK. Kenneth went out of his way to make sure she had a memorable visit. He sent a happy birthday note to our room, with a "free pizza" gift card to Quartino's on State Street, and a 2 "get in free" passes to Howl At the Moon dueling piano bar, and he found us a really nice rate that allowed us to stay an extra day longer than we intended, because we were having such a good time! So THANK YOU, Kenneth, and thank you, Fairfield Inn, for a really nice 50th birthday trip for my sister!! "My kind of town, Chicago is, my kind of town, my kind of people, too, people who smile at you...!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Super cute”
Reviews.Author: valabama
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! The rooms were clean, the service was great, and the color scheme was adorable. Yummy breakfast downstairs that went until 10 AM (because who wants to get up early on vacation?). Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Clean, and did I say nice breakfast?”
Reviews.Author: VRUM
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance and our families stayed in three rooms of this hotel for three days, and we cant be happier for the decision to book this hotel. Don't let the 2 star rating of this hotel fool you, because it is way better than a lot of 4 star hotels I've stayed in. The biggest plus for this hotel is the location, which is in the middle of everything and you visit all the attractions of Chicago on foot. The next plus is its cleanliness, which is very important for me. The continental breakfast was one of the best I've seen, you can really get yourself full and get ready to explore the beautiful city of Chicago. It can get a bit busy after 9AM but you can always find all the items in the breakfast room. The rooms are small but for us it did not matter since we didn't have any plan to spend a lot of time in them. I really recommend this hotel to anyone who cares about the location and having a nice breakfast before starting the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, right off Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: siroglethorpe
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 adults and 3 children, ages 3,4, and 7, booked two rooms from Aug. 1-3. We were exceedingly pleased with the location, which was a mere stone's throw off Michigan Ave. It made it possible to easily walk to things the kids were interested in, eg The American Girl Store and the huge adjoining Lego Store, as well as all the world class shopping that the adults desired. The hotel was clean, and the included breakfast helped the family budget considerably. Subway Sandwich was located right next door, and Panera was across the straight We went to neither, but it is nice to know that if children get cranky, or you wanted to take a simple picnic to Melenium Park, there was an inexpensive option nearby. The only negative was the absence of a pool. The children didn't seem to mind, but it was very hot during our stay, and a pool would have been nice. Yet for the price it was a very reasonable trade off. We would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. This Fairfeild is a step above.”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad4040
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in great location. Near so much that Chicago has to offer, very walkable if you are looking for that. The hotel itself is the nicest Fairfield Inn I have ever stayed at. Priced reasonable compared to other Marriott properties. Staff was great. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: kerry24680
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this fairfield. Hotel was clean and decorated with bright and fun colors. Staff and housekeeping great. Very close to mag. mile. Garrets popcorn next block. Great restaurants close by. Good continental breakfast. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest looking Fairfield I've seen.”
Reviews.Author: SAC-from-Montreal
Reviews.Content: On the one hand, this hotel offers all of the amenities that frequent visitors to Fairfield hotels would expect. Comfortable rooms, free Internet access, complimentary breakfast. On the other hand, this Fairfield does it with style--something that the functional Fairfield chain usually lacks. This lobby and rooms in this hotel look like they were inspired by the Austin Powers movies--a real 60s motif. Not too out there but enough to give the hotel a distinctive look. The location is also terrific--about a block to the heart of the Magnificent Mile, and about 4 blocks to an L station. Plenty of places to eat, plenty of places to shop, movie theatres, and cultural attractions nearby--too many for a short visit. The price is also terrific. It was much more reasonable than most other hotels in the area and the quality is comparable or better to many other hotels I've stayed at in this part of town. Was also impressed with the hotel staff. Friendly, professional, and prompt with answers to questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: sally57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while being a tourist in Chicago. The location was great. Walking distance or a quick cab ride to everything. Two blocks off The Magnificent Mile and centrally located right between the beach and millenium park. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. The continental breakfast was adequate; wouldn't call it great but the coffee was good. The price was best around for the location including breakfast. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: aforsy3691
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you need a clean, quiet place to sleep and a good breakfast. Nothing too fancy, which I happen to like. As you would expect in the city, the rooms are fairly small. However, it was clean, and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The included breakfast is fairly deluxe with make-it-yourself waffles, hot oatmeal, heat and eat breakfast sandwiches, and all of the usual fare.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: MyTimeAtLast
Reviews.Content: Room was nicely decorated and staff was very helpful and friendly. Great location, close to everything and at very reasonable rates. We left the car in the garage for the duration of our stay and walked or took public transportation. Parking costs were a bid pricey but again you're in downtown Chicago. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Neighborhood hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: newlife08
Reviews.Content: The downtown Chicago Fairfield Inn is a hidden gem in Chicago's downtown. Located on a tree lined street one block from the Magnificent Mile and 15 minute walk to the lake, we felt we were in a quiet hidden neighborhood in the city. The hotel is very clean, nicely decorated with a modern decor and the staff is exceptionally helpful. The suite with the living room (pullout sofa), minifridge and microwave make longer stays very comfortable and would work well for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “A neat find of a hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: busview
Reviews.Content: We loved our brief stay in the Fairfield Inn in downtown Chicago. From our call to book the room, where we met Jennifer, who was most helpful and super-groovy, to the friendly doorman who advised us well about nearby restaurants, to the valet parking guy, the staff seems to have gotten it just right. Firing on all cylinders as an accommodations team. We will definitely be back. A nice combination of reasonable price and friendly service - and location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: banderson
Reviews.Content: As far as location, this is about as good as it gets. Less than 2 short blocks to the Magnificent Mile, 3 blocks from Lake Michigan, right on the bus line. Pretty building, very clean. Incredibly helpful and friendly staff. Breakfast is fine, no bells and whistles, but suitable. This is not a fancy, 5star hotel, but a 2 star hotel that is well run. My only complaint is the bathroom lay out (tight) and the view of ... nothing. Request a street side view.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: rcg2
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the hotel. It was clean, nicely decorated and had everything we needed. The only problem was that they were working on the street below and construction went on until midnight. It was difficult to sleep with the noise from the jackhammers! Other than that, the hotel and staff were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Hip decor and location + hop-to-it service = happy stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: agenth2o
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I fell in love with Chicago and plan to return as often as we can. We'd be crazy to stay anywhere else. The hotel sparkles, and so does the staff. In our ninth floor room across from the elevator we were never disturbed by noise, rarely had to wait for an elevator, and enjoyed the Navy Pier's fireworks display while sitting in bed! Sparkles!!

Reviews.Title: “we loved location and the way you can get around”
Reviews.Author: champ5525
Reviews.Content: the hotel was much more then i had expected the location to the shopping was great the service was outstanding and the staff bent over backwards to meet all or needs and the breakfast was great compared to other hotels next time i come to chicago this is the only place i will try to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: cassiah
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful, exceptionally clean, conveniently located and the staff was amazing! Would happily stay there again! Desk agent Carlos Santiago went above and beyond to help my daughter and I plan things to do, we were very grateful to him for all his help! Breakfast was also very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: SCsteve
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield Inn downtown Chicago is a great place to stay. The rooms are newly updated. They serve a great breakfast every morning that is included with the room, and the service was exceptional. It's located just a few blocks from Michigan Ave. and a short walk to the loop and everything downtown. Thanks to Jennifer and all of the staff for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: lraguseo
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the birth of our first grandchild. Since the due date was changed, the staff went out of their way to amend our reservation. Carlos, Janet, Kenny and Monica went as far as calling us while we were driving from NJ to Chicago to accomodate us. Not only was the staff efficient and professional, the property was great. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Steps away from Michigan Ave and the Navy Pier”
Reviews.Author: kaylasmom97
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the front desk very friendly. Our room was ready when we arrived at 2pm. We had a King Suite with sofabed. Wonderful room with a fridge and microwave. The view however was overlooking a roof. The breakfast was the typical, make your own waffles, Jimmy Dean Egg and sauasage sandwiches, bagels, fruit. Overall the room was clean, staff was friendly and loved the location. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “NIce but Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: billybobbiff
Reviews.Content: Chicago is more expensive than NYC...when did that happen? $279 for a room during NeoCon at the Merchandise Mart. Good location for walking to many locations along Michigan Ave and a helpful and pleasant staff. Hailing a cab in front of the hotel can be a time consuming process - walk/drag your pack to the corner and the wait time is cut by 2/3's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: BeckB25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fairfield inn over memorial day weekend and enjoyed it very much. The location was excellent, price was good, and hotel was Clean and modern. The free breakfast was nice. Plenty of selection. The only negative is that some heavy rains caused a leak in our room so housekeeping came and put a large, noisy fan in our room to dry it. A minor inconvenience but had to mention it. Also, I wish there was a pool. My 3year old son would have enjoyed that. Overall, we had a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Trustworthy Staff Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: family5Kc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times the last few years and have always found it quite satisfactory from its location, to its room amenities, to its breakfast, to its price. I packed for this particular trip to Chicago in a hurry, which translates into me overpacking everything, including bringing many, many pieces of special jewelry with me. About 12 hours after checkout, I discovered with great anguish that I had left my entire bag of jewelry in the hotel room. Although my initial call to the night desk staff was less than reassuring or satisfactory as that conversation in no way helped to reduce my panic over the lost jewelry, my contact with the hotel manager and housekeeping management the next morning went beyond my expectations. In a perfect world, since all hotel reservations are made with guest phone numbers and e-mail contact, I would have been contacted by the hotel when my jewelry was found, even before I discovered the jewelry missing, and perhaps procedures are in place that that would have occurred the next day. Regardless, as it turned out, Angelica (yes, a true angel), is a member of the superbly-trained housekeeping team at the Fairfield Inn and Suites, and demonstrates that this large-city hotel actually cares about their guests. Upon finding my jewelry in my room, Angelica saw to it that every item was routed for safekeeping. By arrangement with the hotel manager, my daughter-in-law arrived the next day to claim my items and the hotel staff took several steps to ensure her identity and authority before turning over my items to her. Aside from the obvious, outstanding character of Angelica herself, who cannot love a hotel that staffs and trains its associates to perform beyond expectations? Kudos to Angelica and to the Housekeeping Director, Ms. Rivera, and all who contributed to my happy ending.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Staff Around”
Reviews.Author: karen1196
Reviews.Content: Mother Nature hardly cooperated with our stay in Chicago, however, the staff at the Marriott Fairfield turned a soggy windy trip around. Charles, the concierge, was without a doubt the kindest most helpful informative person I have ever dealt with in a long time. Janet, at the front desk, had the patience of a saint dealing with all my first time questions about Chicago. Kenneth, tirelessly worked with me through my panic attack when I couldn't locate or print my airline boarding passes. Monica, never missed a beat in handleing a very busy lobby during the many severe thunderstorms that plagued the hotel guests over the Memorial weekend. Hats off to the breakfast staff who kept the second floor break room stocked and clean. I will always be grateful for the much needed 24 hour hot coffe and tea, and of course the breakfast. The rooms and every inch of the hotel where always clean and shiny. I truely hope that the Marriott Corporation sees this review. I always stay at Marriott hotels when I travel and have never had a problem. This however, is the first time I have ever posted a review. To the entire staff at the Fairfield in Chicago THANK YOU and keep up the good work. Karen

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: krupanidhi_hm
Reviews.Content: Its really a fabulous stay I had in US. This is really worth staying her eand value for money is felt. Rooms are cosy and close to all tourist business destination and easy access to the airport and train station. Very nice restuarants around. Very good service and co-operative staff for all your needs. What else you want?

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieP418
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights during the Memorial Day Holiday weekend...and could not have been happier!! Front desk staff was very friendly and went above and beyond to see that we enjoyed the city to the fullest! Room was extremely clean, roomy, very stylish, and the bed was sooo comfortable!! Complimentary breakfast was the best of this style, and there was plenty of food at the end of the serving time as there was at the beginning. Location is perfect for just about anywhere you'd want to go - if it was too far to walk, a taxi was always a moment away and we never paid over $10 for any destination. We have stayed in a lot of different hotel chains over the years, but I have to say it again - the front desk staff here were so helpful and happy to answer any and all questions we had. Their recommendations were excellent!! I wish I could recall their names to honor them personally. We give it 5 Stars and a AAA rating, 110%+. The bed was very very comfortable and we never heard noise from the hallway or other rooms - ever! I am a very light sleeper - some sirens in the night would wake me, but never kept me from getting rest.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and service!”
Reviews.Author: shoppgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nightson our first trip trip to Chicago with two young girls. I picked this hotel because of the location and the price. It was fabulous! We arrived at 3:00. The valet area is small (fits 3 cars at any one time) and even though Ontario St is one way, it can get busy. We lucked out that as soon as we arrived two cars pulled out of the valet and we were able to park. Bell services came to help when they noticed how much stuff we started pulling out of the car! We were able to check in right away and got a double room on the 6th floor (out of 15). Bell services followed us up with our luggage cart right away. We were a little surprised at how small the room was (in comparison to what we usually stay in, but then again, this is Chicago downtown, you couldn't expect any more, especially at the rate we got). The view was of the back end of the hotel, and overlooked a roof top and the ventiliation system. Not a pleasant one, but we didn't spend any time looking out the window. The bathroom to the right was adequate, clean and brightly lit. The two double beds were comfy, but small, especially since I am used to sleeping in a large King at home! The TV was a large LG LCD with digital channels! Fabulous! There was a desk area with a comfy desk chair. There is also one sitting chair in the corner. We loved the continental breakfast offered for free, on the second floor. We had make your own waffles, fruit cups, breakfast sandwiches (that you microwaved warm), oatmeal, cerals, bagels, pastries, hard boiled eggs(be sure to cut them up and then nuke them warm), juice, coffee, tea and hot chocolate. It was great to walk down and have a quick, free breakfast, and then head out for a day of sightseeing! We absolutely loved the location of this hotel. We walked towards Michigan Ave (less than 2 minutes) and at the corner was Garrett's Popcorn! My daughter always said that you could tell we reached our hotel by the smell of the popcorn. We saw line ups here every day, all day. We picked up some twice! We had dinner right down the street at Michigan and Ontario at the Grand Lux Cafe. We don't have Cheesecake Factory/Grand Lux chains in Canada, so it was a treat to eat here for us. We also walked to Giordano's (10 min) for great pizza and pasta! We also walked to Navy Pier from the hotel. On the way we stopped into Yolk for lunch. Another hot spot. The service at this hotel is stellar too. From the valet (always quick!), to maintenance services (we had to replace our hairdryer and he came up right away and gave us a brand new one when the one in our bathroom wasn't working), to front desk (who held our luggage for the afternoon). There is a computer with printer in the hotel lobby free for you to use. I also LOVED the FREE WiFi in the rooms! Not many hotels can offer this, but I was happy that this one did and I was able to stay in touch with friends and family from my room using my iPad. If we are to make a trip to Chicago again, I would definitely stay here. It was nice to be able to pop into the hotel during the day to rest or drop off packages. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable First Trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: HuskerKC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Chicago for her 40th Birthday. This was the first time we have visited Chicago. We stayed at the Fairfield on East Ontario. We originally picked this hotel due to its location to Michigan Avenue and for its value as compared to most of the hotels in the area. We truly enjoyed our stay. The entire staff that we interacted with seemed to truly want our stay to be a special one. They suggested restaurants that we should eat at and each suggestion was a home runâ€¦especially Giordanoâ€™s Famous Stuffed Pizza. One of the hotel clerks asked us when we returned to the hotel late in the afternoon on the next day if we had gone to visit Wrigley Field. My wife explained that we werenâ€™t going to Wrigley on her â€œbirthdayâ€� trip but it was something we would consider in the future. We left for an early dinner a little bit later and a night on the town. After we got back to the hotel room, we found a birthday balloon, a personalized cake wishing her happy birthday, and a mini refrigerator waiting for us. We couldnâ€™t believe that the hotel clerks (Kenny and Carlos) would go out of their way to do something like this for their guests. She also received a birthday card signed by all of the staff working that afternoon/evening. The hotel is only a block and a half east of Michigan Avenue which basically is only a two minute walk. Just down the street is Garrettâ€™s Popcorn which we visited twice. Be ready for a line but you MUST visit Garrettâ€™s Popcorn and make sure to take some home with you when you leave. Our room was basic but very clean and it had a good size HDTV. We didnâ€™t spend a ton of time in the room but it was just what we needed. Maria V. made sure the room was in excellent shape after we returned from visiting the sites each day. The hotel has a very good continental breakfast with quite a few choices to start your day off on a good note. We sometimes heard sirens at night due to the hotels location near a hospital but that wonâ€™t deter us from staying there again. We truly want to thank Kenny, Carlos, Charles, Gudelia, Raul, and Maria V. for going out of their way to make my wifeâ€™s 40th Birthday a getaway that we will never forget. We want to visit Chicago again in the near future and we will definitely stay at this hotel. You canâ€™t beat the service, location, and affordability!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value near the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: peace_love_midwest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed one night while we were in town for an event (and basically only needed a clean place to sleep since we would be out most of the time). The Fairfield Inn & Suites is located in downtown Chicago--specifically Streeterville--and is close to the Magnificent Mile, the Water Tower, and Northwestern Memorial Hospital. In fact, our room actually faced the hospital and the sounds of ambulance sirens were heard throughout the night--if this sort of thing bothers you, you might want to specifically request a room on the other side. Otherwise, the room itself was clean and updated with flat screen tv, alarm clock with i-pod dock, and duvets on the bed. The duvet covers were a little on the thin side, but the bedding was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was pretty basic--certainly nothing fancy, but again, it was clean and everything worked properly, which is plenty for a brief overnight stay. We booked our room directly through Marriott's website and couldn't have been more pleased with the low rate--for a room in Chicago, it was definitely a good value. Valet parking with in and out privileges was included in this particular rate along with free wi-fi and free continental breakfast. The lowest rate at the time of booking (other than the one we selected) did not include parking but would be an incredibly good deal for those traveling without a car (the Red Line is a few blocks away). Parking is otherwise pretty expensive, so it's nice if you're able to travel without a car and save some cash. Be sure to look at all the available rates (standard, special packages, etc) when booking to see if there's anything more suited to your needs. I would definitely recommend this hotel to travellers who want to stay downtown without having to pay the usual high price for downtown convenience. I also want to add that the staff was really friendly and welcoming. After we checked out, we wanted to walk around a bit more and grab some lunch before heading out of town, so the front desk nicely stored our bags for us and we were able to keep our car parked through the valet long after check-out. We had a good (albeit short) stay at the Fairfield Inn and Suites and would definitely consider going back next time we're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “One night only”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a girls night out and the location couldn't have been better. Staff was friendly and helpful. They allowed us to check in early. We had decided to get a cot for the room and the delivered it with 5 minutes of making the request. My friend who slept on the cot is 5 months pregnant and said she was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, but avoid large groups”
Reviews.Author: kampan
Reviews.Content: Fairfield Inn as usual, it's clean and tidy. Its location is excellent, walking distance to all the shops. But cuz of the price and location, popular for hig school kids during spring break. I stayed in this hotel 3 times in past 4 weeks, and there were large groups of teens (with parents and teachers). If staying on the same floor, they could be loud. One nite at 2am, a teenage boy kept knocking my door for minutes, I finally opened door, and "Opus, sorry, wrong room"... Breakfast area is not that big as well, if you happen to run into large groups, can be a slight problem if your schedule is tight. Customers I need to meet like hotel for the price and location. I will still come back, as spring break ends in May.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning our next stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chiluvrs
Reviews.Content: Super location! Super clean! Super comfy beds! Super complimentary breakfast! All we were looking for was an affordable place to spend spring break. We found that and so much more.... +One of the cleanest bathrooms of anyplace we've ever stayed :) +Beds as comfortable as home with great pillows (a huge thing for someone who sleeps with three, only needed two) and you can request the type of pillows you want and how many when you make your reservation. +A complimentary breakfast with more choices than you could think of, serviced by a friendly pair of ladies who replenished the foods and kept everything spotless. +You can walk everywhere from here, the bus stop to the aquarium and museums is right across Michigan Ave. and Gino's is right around the corner - yum! The Fairfield staff signs a "promise", you can read about it in your room and it hangs behind the front desk, out of sight for some reason. So while you can see how well they did on keeping those promises, the promise to make us fell welcome didn't hold true. The front desk supervisor was one of the least friendly people we encountered on our trip. But her unpleasant demeanor won't keep us from going back, because everything else was SUPER! p.s. Don't worry when you walk off of the elevator and your room is right across the hall, we weren't bothered by it a bit. However, the connecting rooms make you feel like the folks next door are staying in the same room :(

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mackenna65
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my daughters, ages 8, 10 & 17. We all loved the hotel. Recently updated and very clean. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were adequately sized for us to get around in - we did not spend a lot of time in the room but were comfortable when we were there. Great shower with high water pressure and hot! Great breakfast options. Only 1 1/2 blocks off Mich Ave. Lots of different food choices in the area. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: NorthCostGuy
Reviews.Content: It's a Fairfield. Good, not great, clean, not overly plush. It's a Fairfield. The staff was above average, our bellman Charles was a great ambassador and concierge. Get the 20% off coupon for Timothy O'Toole's down the street. Parking is $42 a night, well within Chicago market prices but enough to factor into your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelGuelph
Reviews.Content: Recently my mom, sister and I had the opportunity to visit Chicago and we stayed at the Fairfield Inn and Suites in Chicago. Not only was this hotel centrally located near Michigan Ave (The Maginificient Mile), it was within walking distance (or a short cab ride) to Millenium Park, along with t\The Aquarium, The Field Museum and The Planetarium. The staff we also extremely friendly and accomodating. Kenneth, Charles and ALL of the staff were very welcoming and helped answer all of our many questions. Great location, great service! We would definitely return and would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value downtown”
Reviews.Author: JonTbartek
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, excellent location, friendly helpful staff. If you are planning on hitting the museums, the Navy Pier, etc, this hotel provides great location and is a real value. Tons of good restaurants close, walk to the Pier, catch CTA buses a couple blocks away. Property doesn't have a pool, which was only drawback for kids, but the free breakfast, location, and staff more than made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: 11kwv11
Reviews.Content: Nice interior design. Rooms was good. Maybe small for some, but I don't need any more for sleeping. Very nice service. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience in the Windy City - Thanks Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Karlaaaa
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent for shopping. The hotel was clean and efficient. The staffers were kind and helpful. The concierge was fabulous in helping me with heavy bags, directions and taxis as needed. Carlos was a class act. Wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and good location.”
Reviews.Author: mrstrick
Reviews.Content: Great value. My room was $109.00 for a hotel just blocks off Michigan Avenue. Hotel and rooms were extremely clean. Free wired and wifi. No room service or restaurant, but breakfast buffett was fine and there are several nearby restaurants. I will stay again next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations-Great Service-Great Location-Great Price!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luciaBeverlyHills
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I arrived it was late in the evening (after 10pm) and we were greeted with warm smiles as soon as we pulled up. The room was spacious with a nice view. We were starving the next morning and were so happy to have the complimentary continental breakfast at no cost(which we did not know was offered at time of booking). The Fairfield Inn and Suites is conveniently located between The Magnificent Mile and Lakeshore Drive and we cannot wait to return August and we will be staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: et81
Reviews.Content: I can't say anything bad about this hotel. I was in Chicago for one day for business. At check in, the front desk clerk was very professional and friendly. When we asked him for a restaurant recommendation, he went out of his way to find a discount card for the pub on the corner. The location is excellent, just one block from the Magnificent Mile. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. Included in our rate was a continental breakfast which included coffee, juice, bagels, muffins, and even make-it-yourself waffle station. There's a computer in the lobby which you can use for free and also complimentary wi-fi throughout the hotel. If I'm back in Chicago for business, I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, and a good value for Michigan Ave.”
Reviews.Author: 2tampuh2
Reviews.Content: A nice, simple hotel for anyone looking to stay downtown near Michigan Avenue shops. Lobby is modern but small and parking is fairly cheap (compared to other hotels). Rooms are simply furnished and small but very neat and clean. Service was decent, (strangely the security officer is the one who brought up extra towels and pillows). The only real complaint with the room was the pillows, extremely small, flat, and uncomfortable. Overall for the price ($80) the value cannot be beaten considering the location, cleanliness, and free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but feels like a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeninthechi
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is amazing, a block from the Magnificent Mile, a 7-11 around the corner, a bus to Union Station right outside the door. I couldn't fault them on that or how easy it was to get to. The hotel has obviously been updated recently, with a lot of flashy modern decor, bright lights etc. It looks nice on the surface but once you enter the hotel the older, cheaper hotel look is still there. We stayed in a king 'suite' which would have been a small room without the divide, but it felt even smaller with the wall in there. I realize that mattress firmness is a very individual preference, but this bed was way too soft for us. I barely slept and my back was really aching by morning. Breakfast is always free here which was great, the selection was limited to the usual free breakfast choices - bagels, donuts, yoghurts, cereal, waffles etc. I don't know if we would stay here again. I probably would recommend it to friends for the location but only if they were on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel staff in the city!”
Reviews.Author: TPeter4
Reviews.Content: The friendly and helpful staff is far and away what distinguishes the Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown. Certainly the accommodations are excellent for a hotel in this price range, but the staff is what really makes this an exceptional hotel. They are quick with restaurant or entertainment recommendations and will go the extra mile to help you get what you need. During my stay, I wanted to pick up some Girl Scout cookies and one of the hotel employees actually put me in touch with his niece so I could put in an order. Additionally, the hotel's location is unbeatable. It's short walk from Michigan Ave. and other great Chicago attractions. The continental breakfast includes a waffle maker, which is quite a nice touch. You can't go wrong with the Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kayellpee
Reviews.Content: I was staying in chicago for just one night on a business trip and chose this hotel due to it's location close to where my meeting was. Not only was this hotel close to my meeting, but it was within walking distance of many restaurants and bars, Timothy O'Tooles right across the street was great. Very clean, great service. the only thing that was a negative to me was the EXPENSIVE valet charge ($40 per night) and you could park yourself for free, it cost $32 to self park. There were no other self parking lots around this area so using the hotel garage was the only option. That being said, I did have a great view from my hotel window of a very frozen Lake michigan. would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great home/office away from home”
Reviews.Author: phillytransplant
Reviews.Content: I was travelling for business and found the Fairfield a comfortable modern hotel, with exellent amenities, right in the heart of Chicago. Hotel has it all, comfortable suite, large comfortable bed, large bathroom, closets, living room. I could work, rest and find great restaurants, shops all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay- as expected!”
Reviews.Author: ImprovMom
Reviews.Content: After reading the many, many positive reviews, I didn't have any worries about booking a stay here for a weekend getaway w/ a friend. And...as expected...we had a very good experience. The lobby is small but very sleek & modern. Every staff member was friendly and helpful. Our room was clean & comfortable. Even though the hotel is in a GREAT location, just a block & half off Michigan Ave, it was too cold for us wimps to walk around so we cabbed instead. Valet parking is only $9 more and worth it because the self park is on the next street over and down a little, plus it offers in/out privileges. We had reserved a room w/ two doubles and asked to be away from the elevators since my friend & I are both light sleepers. We were told that all the doubles are by the elevators & the kings make up the rest of the rooms on each floor, but were assured that there was soundproofing so we shouldn't hear the elevator noise. We were happy to find this true- we didn't hear a PEEP from the elevators, just the crying baby next door. A breakfast buffet is included which had all the standard cereal, yogurt, bagels, juice etc, plus hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, a waffle maker & batter and breakfast sandwiches & mini-quiches that you could heat in the microwave. It's not a 5 star plush hotel w/ fancy robes and such but you can't beat the cleanliness & value for the money here. The only negative was that we came back after a long Saturday night out & were planning to watch a pay-per-view movie, but the tv's do not have that option. Oh well...minor detail. Thanks Fairfield- I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Location, Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alelex
Reviews.Content: We was to the FairField Chicago for 3 nights in September, and that was second stay in "Marriott" hotels in Chicago. This hotel had really good price (for good room, large, with sofa, 2 tv's) at a higher floor. The room (bed) was confy, the hotel is really near Michigan Ave, good restaurants near the room and parking near the hotel. I go back to Chicago next month and I will go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the Location”
Reviews.Author: kimawms
Reviews.Content: We came downtown for some Christmas shopping, the location couldn't have been better for this. The room was very spacious and very comfortable. The breakfast was very good. Staff is excellent, they couldn't have been more accomidating. Definitely recommend to others and will try to stay here again when going into the city.

Reviews.Title: “A good location”
Reviews.Author: carribeandreams
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend. it was easy to find and very conveniently located to all the touristy things in Chicago. The front desk staff was very polite and the valet was great. The room was clean and surprisingly quiet. The bed was a little uncomfortable but I am like "The Princess and the Pea". There is a great breakfast place right down the street and very good Indian restaurant located above it. Coffee is served 24 hrs a day on the second floor. The internet was not WIFI....I guess that is my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth staying at!”
Reviews.Author: Rista
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel over one of the other high end hotels in the same area, because it had much better reviews. Let's just say I'm so glad that I took the advise of the people here on Trip advisor and stayed here. We arrived much earlier than check in time, 11am. With our luck, they had a room ready! The hotel lobby, room, elevators and hallways were all very nice and clean. Everything was bright and cheery, jetsons like decor in the lobby and nice classic furniture in the rooms. We had a king suite which has a separate living room, with a desk. 2 tv's in the room. 2 closets. And an average bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable!!! My only complaint was it was a walk in the middle of the night from the bed to the bathroom, which in our room was situated as you just walk in the room. Regular thermostats on the heat/air, no messing with those silly heaters that don't work. We also had a fridge and microwave, which would come in handy later for handling our leftovers from Gino's east. The hotel also includes free wi-fi and serve yourself breakfast.. which gave us a break from eating out for that meal. This hotel was 1 block off Michigan avenue, close to all the major shopping. Try Garrett's popcorn... that stuff is OFF THE HOOK! =D We would absolutely stay at this hotel again, it was more than I expected, the price was awesome for the dates we chose, and the staff was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Recent Renovation for New Look”
Reviews.Author: IlliniRon
Reviews.Content: This is a great location near the magnificent mile in Chicago, and the hotel was recently renovated, so the rooms are high quality and very clean looking. There is a nice breakfast on the second floor, staff is attentive to needs, etc. We would definitely stay here again. I was really happy with being allowed to check into the suite early am, due to having a suite available, and the overall value of this property. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and really nice suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: lady_hlh
Reviews.Content: This was a really good property in a great location for exploring Chicago. They had a very nice free continental breakfast every AM in a spacious room with TVs, the staff was really on top of refilling everything and cleaning up.
